image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives, Gift of the U.S. Association of Former Members of Congress

profileText: A Representative from New Mexico; born in Chicago, Ill.; March 18, 1947; B.A., University of Illinois, Chicago, Ill., 1968; J.D., University of New Mexico Law School, Albuquerque, N. Mex., 1972; lawyer, private practice; New Mexico Air National Guard, 1969-1998; assistant district attorney, Bernalillo County, N. Mex., 1972-1977; assistant city attorney and counsel for the Albuquerque police department, 1979-1981; district attorney, Bernalillo County, N. Mex., 1980-1988; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred First and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1989-March 25, 1998); died on March 25, 1998, in Albuquerque, N. Mex; interment in Fairview Cemetery, Albuquerque, N. Mex.

researchRecord.name: ca. 1988-1990, 1 videocassette and 7 sound tape reels.
researchRecord.description: Includes eleven commercials used during the campaigns of Steven Schiff for the 1988 and 1990 U.S. congressional elections in Illinois, Democratic party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: 1977-1998, 19 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Correspondence, reports and news articles covering Schiff's service in Congress. The collection also includes personal material.
